Column Comment.0: SEISMIC TRANSACTION: A transaction in which seismic data is exchanged, sold ortraded according to the terms of an agreement.
Column Comment.1: SEIS TRANSACTION TYPE: The type of seismic transaction, such as sale, licensing,farm in etc.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: CURRENCY CONVERSION RATE: the rate applied to convert the currency from itsoriginal monetary UOM to the stored UOM. This value is valid for this row in this tableonly. When this value is multiplied by the STORED currency value, the original valueof the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.4: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the currency in which the funds wereinitially received. When the Stored currency is multiplied by the CURRENCYCONVERSION, the value of the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: LENGTH: the total length of the transaction
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: PRICE PER LENGTH: cost per length which was applied to the transaction.
Column Comment.11: REFERENCE NUMBER: file number that is assigned by a client.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: TOTAL PRICE: The total price for the transaction.
Column Comment.15: Reverse Engineered from column TRANSACTION_DATE of tableSEIS_TRANSACTION
Column Comment.16: TRANSACTION STATUS: The status of this transaction, such as complete and paid,pending approval, approved, cancelled etc.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
